  • Field Details

    • useFOC

      public boolean useFOC
      Flag to indicate whether Field-Oriented Control (FOC) is enabled for the motor. FOC allows more efficient control of the motor, particularly in situations requiring precision or dynamic performance.

    • StatorSupplyCurrentEnable

      public boolean StatorSupplyCurrentEnable
      Flag to enable or disable stator supply current monitoring for the motor. When enabled, it allows monitoring of the stator current, which can be useful for diagnostics and safety purposes.

    • StatorSupplyCurrentLimit

      public double StatorSupplyCurrentLimit
      The limit on the stator supply current (in Amps) to protect the motor from overcurrent situations. This limit is applied when stator current monitoring is enabled.

    • SupplyCurrentLimitEnable

      public boolean SupplyCurrentLimitEnable
      Flag to enable or disable the supply current limit for the motor. When enabled, it imposes a limit on the amount of current supplied to the motor to prevent damage or overuse.

    • SupplyCurrentLimit

      public double SupplyCurrentLimit
      The maximum supply current limit (in Amps) for the motor. This is the threshold beyond which current is limited to protect the motor from excessive current draw.

    • SupplyCurrentThreshold

      public double SupplyCurrentThreshold
      The threshold (in Amps) for detecting supply current spikes. This is used in combination with the supply current limit to trigger actions when current exceeds the threshold.

    • SupplyTimeThreshold

      public double SupplyTimeThreshold
      The time threshold (in seconds) for supply current spikes. If the supply current exceeds the threshold for a period longer than this value, a protective action might be taken.

    • openLoop

      public OptionalConfigCtre.RampAndLoopConfiguration openLoop
      Configuration for open-loop motor control, which refers to motor control without feedback, typically used for speed control or simpler applications. This configuration includes ramping and looping parameters specific to open-loop control.

    • closedLoop

      public OptionalConfigCtre.RampAndLoopConfiguration closedLoop
      Configuration for closed-loop motor control, which uses feedback (e.g., from a sensor) to maintain a set speed or position. This configuration includes ramping and looping parameters specific to closed-loop control.

  • Constructor Details

    • OptionalConfigCtre

      public OptionalConfigCtre()
